seo.learnTitle: A practical way to learn Bangla Sign Language

seo.learnP2: Quizzes and spaced-repetition flashcards help you remember signs over time — whether you are just starting or reviewing what you learned.
seo.whoP1: This project is built to support communication in Bangladesh and beyond. It is useful for:
seo.whoList1: Learners who want to start with the basics
seo.whoList2: Families, friends, teachers, and support workers
seo.howList1: Search a word or pick a category
seo.howList2: Watch the sign video and save it if needed
seo.howList4: Review with flashcards and spaced repetition

meta.title: Collaboration & White-label - Love to Learn Sign
meta.description: Partner with Love to Learn Sign to publish a sign language dictionary via co-branding or a fully white-labeled app. Learn how per-dictionary monetization can be organized (ads and subscriptions).

collaboration.pageDescription: Partner with Love to Learn Sign to make sign language learning more accessible. Launch a co-branded dictionary experience or a fully white-labeled app, with a revenue model organized per dictionary.
collaboration.heroTitle: A platform built to share sign language — beyond a single dictionary
collaboration.heroP1: I built Love to Learn Sign because I care about making sign language learning more accessible. Today, the website and app focus on Bangla Sign Language — and the same approach can help other sign languages grow through a modern, learner-friendly dictionary experience.
collaboration.heroP2: Partners bring the language content: you create the sign videos and keep ownership of what you record. We provide the platform, product, and learning flow so your dictionary can reach learners on mobile.
collaboration.ctaContact: Contact us to discuss a partnership
collaboration.whatYouGet1: A modern dictionary experience with short sign videos
collaboration.whatYouGet2: Favorites and learning features (quizzes, flashcards, practice flow)
collaboration.whatYouGet3: Clear content ownership: you keep ownership of your recorded videos and language content
collaboration.whatYouGet4: A platform offered via licence/subscription (not a one-time sale), plus monetization options discussed case-by-case
collaboration.importantBody: This page does not list pricing. We’ll shape the technical setup, branding, and revenue model based on your needs.
collaboration.coBrandingBody: Fast launch, shared branding. Your dictionary lives on the platform with your identity visible alongside Love to Learn Sign. For co-branding, videos must follow the same format as the existing Love to Learn Sign content — we provide a tool called L2L Video Editor to help trim and crop videos so the whole dictionary stays consistent.
collaboration.whiteLabelBody: Your own app name and brand. The platform powers the experience, but your users see your identity first. For white-label, video format is flexible — we can recommend a consistent format, and L2L Video Editor remains available if you want to standardize.
collaboration.whiteLabelPros1: Your own brand and app name
collaboration.platformWorksTitle: How the platform works (in simple terms)
collaboration.perDictionaryBody: Each dictionary can be treated as its own dedicated space (content, categories, and visibility). This allows multiple sign languages to coexist while keeping each one organized.
collaboration.revenueBody: The platform is provided as a licence/subscription to use the product and infrastructure (not a one-time sale). Monetization can be organized per dictionary. A common approach is to return ad revenue generated by a dictionary back to the organization operating that dictionary on the platform. Subscription details depend on your option and scope.
collaboration.faqA1: Co-branding means we publish a dictionary experience powered by this platform while keeping Love to Learn Sign visible alongside your organization’s identity (name, logo, and messaging). It’s a fast way to launch with shared branding and shared maintenance.
collaboration.faqA2: White-label means you get an app experience that is fully branded for your organization (your name, your visual identity, and your store presence). The platform remains the engine, but the product looks and feels like your own app.
collaboration.faqQ3: Do you support sign languages beyond Bangla Sign Language?
collaboration.faqA3: Yes. The platform is designed so other sign languages can benefit from the same learning flow: dictionary browsing, short videos, favorites, and practice features. Each dictionary can be handled as its own dedicated space.
collaboration.faqQ4: How does revenue sharing work (ads and subscriptions)?
collaboration.faqA4: We can organize monetization per dictionary. The general approach is that ad revenue for a given dictionary is paid back to the organization operating that dictionary on the platform. Subscription details depend on your setup, so we discuss the exact model together.
collaboration.faqA5: You keep ownership of your sign language content and the videos you record. In co-branding, we align on a shared video format for consistency (L2L Video Editor is provided to crop/trim). In white-label, format is flexible. In all cases, the platform itself is provided via a licence/subscription to use the product and infrastructure.
collaboration.faqA6: Send a message with your sign language, expected content size, and your preferred option (co-branding or white-label). We’ll reply with questions, a proposed setup, and next steps.
collaboration.faqQ7: Who creates the videos, and what format should they follow?
collaboration.faqA7: Partners create the sign videos. For co-branding, videos should match the existing Love to Learn Sign format; we provide L2L Video Editor to help you crop and trim to the standard. For white-label, video format is flexible (we can still recommend a consistent format).
collaboration.faqA8: No. The platform is provided via a licence/subscription to use the product and infrastructure. The exact scope (setup, branding, and revenue model) is discussed case-by-case.
collaboration.closingBody: Send a short message with your sign language, the size of your dictionary, and your preferred option (co-branding or white-label). We’ll come back with a few questions and a clear proposal.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.description: Privacy Policy for Love to Learn Sign. Learn how we collect, use, and protect your information when you use our Bangla Sign Language learning app.
privacy.lede: This page describes how {appName} collects, uses, and protects your information across our website, dashboard, and mobile app.
privacy.disclaimerBody: This Privacy Policy is written to reflect the current functionality of our products and infrastructure. It has not been reviewed by a lawyer and does not constitute legal advice.

sections.title: 1. Scope
paragraphs: This Privacy Policy applies to the Love to Learn Sign website, the admin dashboard, and the Love to Learn Sign mobile application (the “Services”).
The Services are developed and operated by {developerName}.
If you only browse the public website, we generally do not ask you to create an account. If you sign in to the dashboard, account information is required.

sections.title: 2. Information we collect
paragraphs: We collect information you provide directly, and information collected automatically when you use the Services.

lists.title: 2.1 Information you provide
items: Email address (for account creation and sign-in)
Display name (optional)
Country selection (for onboarding and app experience)
Language preferences (English/Bengali)
Quiz settings and learning preferences
Favorites (saved words/signs) and learning history (e.g., quiz history)
Optional notes you choose to provide during signup (free text)
Support emails you send to us (and the information you choose to include)

lists.title: 2.2 Information collected automatically
items: Device information (operating system version, device model, app version)
App usage data (features used, time spent, video views)
Performance and diagnostic data (app crashes, errors)
Cache data (downloaded video content for offline viewing)
Usage counters used to determine when to show advertisements (for non‑premium users)
Push notification tokens (e.g., Firebase Cloud Messaging token) to deliver notifications (if enabled)
Basic web server logs for the website (for example: IP address, request time, and requested page)

lists.title: 2.3 Anonymous dictionary search analytics (app)
items: We may log dictionary searches with sanitized query text, timestamp, selected category/language, result count, and whether matches were found.
Search analytics do not store your email or user ID. They are used in aggregate to identify missing words and improve content coverage.

lists.title: 2.4 Premium subscriptions and purchases
items: Subscription type (monthly/yearly) and subscription status (active/inactive)
Store receipts and purchase records are processed by Google Play / Apple App Store. We do not receive your payment card details.

lists.title: We use information to
items: Provide and maintain the Services
Authenticate users and manage accounts (website/dashboard/app)
Personalize the learning experience (settings, favorites, progress)
Send reminders/notifications when you enable them
Manage premium subscriptions and access
Display advertisements for non‑premium users
Improve performance, reliability, and user experience
Protect against abuse and secure our Services

sections.title: 4. Third‑party services
paragraphs: We rely on third‑party services to operate the Services. These providers may process data according to their own policies.

lists.title: 4.1 Google Firebase (Google LLC)
items: Firebase Authentication (accounts and sign‑in)
Firestore Database (content, preferences, counters)
Firebase Storage / Hosting (video and media delivery)
Cloud Functions (backend logic such as subscription/role updates)
Firebase Cloud Messaging (push notifications)

lists.title: 4.2 Google Mobile Ads (AdMob)
items: We use AdMob to show ads to non‑premium users (for example interstitial and rewarded ads).
AdMob may collect advertising identifiers and interaction data to provide ads.

lists.title: 4.3 App stores (payments)
items: Google Play Billing (Android) and Apple In‑App Purchase (iOS) process subscription payments.
We do not store payment card information.

lists.title: 4.4 Donations (website)
items: If you donate using links on our website, the payment is processed by the selected provider (e.g., Stripe / Ko‑Fi / Buy Me a Coffee).
We do not receive your payment card details from these providers.

lists.title: 5.1 Local storage (device)
items: Settings, favorites, and cached videos may be stored on your device.
Some counters/session data may be stored locally for guest users.

lists.title: 5.2 Cloud storage (Firebase)
items: Account and profile information is stored in Firebase services.
Subscription status and access flags may be stored in Firestore.
Usage counters and anonymous search analytics may be stored in Firestore.

lists.title: 5.3 Retention
items: Local data is removed when you uninstall the app (unless you backed it up separately).
Account data is retained until you request account deletion.
Some records may be retained for legal/accounting reasons where required (for example store transaction records held by the stores).

lists.title: You can
items: Access and change some preferences in the app
Control notification permissions in your device settings
Cancel subscriptions via Google Play / App Store settings
Request deletion of your account (see the Delete Account page)
Contact us to ask questions about your data

sections.title: 7. Security
paragraphs: We use reasonable technical measures to protect your information, including encrypted connections (HTTPS) and access controls. However, no system can be guaranteed 100% secure.

sections.title: 8. Children’s privacy
paragraphs: We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13. If you believe a child has provided personal information, contact us and we will take appropriate steps.

sections.title: 9. Changes to this policy
paragraphs: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. The “Last updated” date will reflect the latest version.

sections.title: 10. Contact
paragraphs: For privacy questions or data requests, contact us at {supportEmail}.

deleteAccount.title: Delete Account
deleteAccount.description: Learn how to delete your Love to Learn Sign account and what data is deleted or kept. Step-by-step instructions for account deletion.
deleteAccount.descriptionText: This page explains how to request deletion of your {appName} account (by {developerName}) and what data is deleted or kept.
deleteAccount.requestStep3: In the email body, include the email address you used to create your {appName} account.
deleteAccount.processingTime: We typically process account deletion requests within {days} business days after verifying the request.
whatDeletedItems: Your authentication account (Firebase Authentication) associated with your email address
Your user profile stored in our database (e.g., display name, country, hearing status, app preferences, account status/approval)
Usage counters linked to your account (e.g., video view counters, game session counters)
Subscription access flags/roles stored in our systems (premium entitlement status)
deleteAccount.whatKept: What data may be kept (and why)
whatKeptItems: Store purchase records are processed and retained by Google Play (and/or Apple App Store) under their own policies. We do not control those records.
Accounting / legal records may be retained for the period required by applicable laws (for example, records related to subscription transactions).

Anonymous dictionary search analytics are stored without personal identifiers (no email/user ID). Because they are not linked to your identity, they cannot be selectively deleted per user and may be kept in aggregate.
deleteAccount.optionalTitle: Optional: delete some data without deleting your account
deleteAccount.optionalIntro: If you only want to remove certain data:
optionalItems: You can clear locally stored data (such as favorites, history, and cached videos) from within the app, or by clearing the app’s storage / uninstalling the app.
You can also email {email} to request deletion of specific account-linked data without deleting your entire account (when technically possible).
